name: CreateFileSystemShortcut
description:
Create a file system shortcut for a project environment.

This tool allows you to create a file system shortcut in a specified environment for a project in Datadog. Use it to quickly set up shortcuts for accessing environment-specific directories.

parameters.name: project_identifier
parameters.description: The unique ID of the project to access. Obtain it via a call to /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

parameters.name: shortcut_identifier
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the filesystem shortcut to be created. Used to distinguish this shortcut.

parameters.name: file_system_path
parameters.description: The file system path where the shortcut will point to. This should specify the environment-specific directory.

parameters.name: creation_timestamp
parameters.description: The timestamp indicating when the file system shortcut was created. Format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ.

parameters.name: shortcut_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of shortcut to create, such as "folder" or "file".

parameters.name: reference_name
parameters.description: A string representing the reference name for the file system shortcut. Use a unique identifier or description that aids in shortcut identification.

parameters.name: target_href
parameters.description: The URL or path to which the file system shortcut will point. This should be a valid string representing the reference destination.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.
